Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherine F
Reviews.Content: Can't complain about the hotel. gives a feel of a typical boutique hotel. The room was very cozy.Hotel offers free wi-fi there which was another huge plus. The staff was extremly nice and helpful. Due to my return flight to miami being so early i had to leave the hotel at 4:00am! The front desk gentleman was there to help me with my bags and called a taxifor me. I felt extremly bad for waking him up at that time but he had a smile the whole time. The hotel has a great location. Walking distance to Sultanahmet Square and many shops and restaurants. If you ask for advice on dinner they immedietly recommend the restaurant next door to them- Divnine. they probably have an agreement with the owner, but its definitely worth going. The food was excellent! Breakfast at the hotel was descent. I'm not a big fan of buffets, but they had a good selection of items. Overall my stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful days here and from the first friendly greeting we were very happy with the hotel. Very conveniently located, and as others have noted the tram just outside the window was a bit noisy and so was the 5 am call to prayer, but we didn't mind as this was part of the attraction of Istanbul. A comfortable room, with a good breakfast, and fast internet...a real plus. We really appreciated the staff, especially the lovely Suheyla and handsome Serhat, who were efficient, kind, and helpful. We called in a week later to say "Hello" when we stopped in Istanbul on our cruise and were greeted like old friends.We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfy”
Reviews.Author: danielsuzie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Empire Palace, very central, friendly and helpful staff especially Jaila (spelt wrong probably!). Good, plentiful breakfast, comfortable, clean if fairly basic room. On tram route so quite exposed to local noise including call to prayer 5am, but got used to that, as you do. Istanbul was great especially Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, both stunning. Food in local restaurants not exceptional but all OK, liked Ozler Restaurant the best. Very good short break (4 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul city break”
Reviews.Author: DrewellYateley
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon on Monday to be greeted by friendly and efficient staff. We talked about arranging a city tour and a Bosphorous boat trip and they helped us to select and booked the next 2 days before we went to dinner. Excellent value for money trips, great advice. Rooms clean and the staff made the stay more enjoyable. Great position if you want to stay in the old town, and no more than 10 minute walk from the Galata Bridge and the Hippodrome. No hesitation in recommending Empire Palace or Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them tell you your reservation is down the street”
Reviews.Author: skloks
Reviews.Content: Greats: It's a great location at a great price for a clean, spacious, and quality room. Not so Greats: The staff weren't able to offer much sound advice about the city--for example they couldn't tell me where I could get delivery food or where to find a henna tattoo place. Some of their advice was inconsistent and later found to be incorrect so if you are looking for concierge service this is not the place to look. Additionally, the hotel continually smelled like cigarette smoke in the hallways and they did not initiate any leadership in order to fix this problem. Terribles: Despite confirming the reservation by address by email and phone the week prior, when we arrived they tried to tell us that our reservation was with their sister hotel "Seres" down the street. They eventually got us into the Empire Palace the next day, but it was a terrible and disappointing experience that they would try to exploit travelers this way and attempt to make them stay at a cheaper venue that doesn't hold a candle in quality to Empire Palace. Thankfully my husband did his double checks before arriving, knew without a doubt where we were to be staying, and didn't take no for an answer. It was a shameful introduction to the tactics of the Empire Palace.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roberts00100
Reviews.Content: i have been stayed there 2 nights. good location and really friendly staffs

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: cojacq
Reviews.Content: My son and I found this to be an excellent choice for a first visit to this fascinating city. I requested the transfer service by email and it went without a hitch. The staff were all unfailingly friendly and courteous. As others have mentioned, the location is ideal with the major sites within walking distance as well as the tram and ferry port. Also ,as others have said, there is an issue with tram noise. It's as well to ask for a room away from the main road. We were also aware of a persistent electrical hum which switched off about midnight. The room was nicely decorated, very clean {as was the entire hotel} and had a very good shower. Smokers will be glad to know that there was no problem about a smoking room {also requested in advance by email}. Oh yes, the beds were most welcome after long days dodging the carpet,hat,guide book,restaurant etc. hustlers. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Divya m
Reviews.Content: we have just come back after staying for 6 nights in Empire palace hotel in Istanbul. This hotel is in ideal location, approx 5 minutes walk from Topkapi Palace, blue mosque, Basilica cistern and all the major attractions in old city. This hotel provides excellent service, specially lady called Sahila was excellent, nothing was too much trouble for her. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for nice hotel in good location

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Content: Although we got off to s shaky start they had overbooked and couldn't have our correct room until the following day, the friendly staff especially receptionist Sliheyla did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. Booking restaurants and cabs etc . Our room was clean and comfortable and the location of the hotel was fantastic we were able to walk to all the major sights .

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: KSydorenko
Reviews.Content: Beside its perfect location - 5 minute walk from St.Sophia and Sultanahmet - this hotel provides one with clean and tidy rooms and very good level service. The personnel is very friendly and willing to help. We really enjoied our stay there and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Old Town, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Harpista
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived at the hotel we were made welcome. We made our way from the airport via train and train, straight forward as the hotel is right next to the tram line in the Old Town, and a few minutes walk from the main railway station. Our room was comfortable, beautifully clean, quiet, and furnished with an excellent mattress, and a good sized bathroom. Breakfast is served on the 6th floor on the roof terrace which looks out over to the Bosphorus on one side, and glimpses of urban life all around. The staff all made a great effort to communicate and to ensure that we had what we wanted. There was a choice of traditional Turkish breakfast of cheeses, olives, bread, cold meats, jams, yoghurt, honey also hot food and endless tea or coffee. The menu for the evening meals looked good but there were so many excellent restaurants in the surrounding areas that we did not eat in at all. The Hammam was closed during our stay but should be open in a couple of weeks. If you walk up the hill you can reach the Topkapi Palace Museum in a couple of minutes and beyond that, the Ayia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are just another few hundred metres beyond. All in all, a very friendly, hospitable and relaxing place to stay. Good value for money, and hugely helpful staff. If you take the time to try and learn a bit of basic Turkish, it will be greatly appreciated, but everyone spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gyu Sung C
Reviews.Content: It was terrible experience in Istanbul because of this hotel. When we arrived this hotel, they overbooked no more room was left. So they sent us to other place... the worse hotel... even we reserved superior room... Terrible... there is no service no consideration no isolation nothing... even high price... Just one good thing is that evertthing is in the walking distance from this hotel... This is the first time like this kind of service... It seems that no one knows about the service. A quality of this hotel is similar to B&B in Germany... Bad experience....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Water F
Reviews.Content: A very clean, well managed and maintained property that offers the best possible location for those exploring the city by foot or tram. Easy to get to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand and Spice Bazaars, and, the Bosphorus River boat offerings. Cannot say enough about the service. Excellent excellent excellent The buffet breakfast is a mix of North American and Turkish which was perfect. It was also a very neat experience to site outside the hotel in the alleyway and enjoy tea while watching all the street activity.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: tripowl44
Reviews.Content: The collection service from airport and drop off took the hassle out. (not free) Staff very nice indeed. I did ask for a room with a VIEW but got back yard on low floor so heard every foot step of everyone which felt was like outside our door! Tea\coffee in room as standard would of been nice ie a kettle. There was no iron. Heard the trams pass all day nite the charm wears off! BUT the staff cleaned our room even late afternoon which is almost unheard of so that was lovely. Location is wonderful and buy your Turkish sweets opposite,brill. Free water always in mini bar nice touch. Great place and if call to pray puts you off your in the wrong country lol.

Reviews.Title: “Happy experience”
Reviews.Author: F O
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, in the heart of ancient Istanbul. Excellent availability and reliability of staff. They have helped me a lot to retrieve a forgotten bag. I recommend this hotel for the professionalism. Istanbul is a fantastic town.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality, conveniantly located”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaF3
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Empire Palace is in the heart of the old city (a little bit noisy because of the tramway) and near all the famous places such as Aya Sofia, Blue Mosk, Topkapi and Grand Bazar. rooms are comfortable and very clean. Staff is competent,very obliging and friendly (everyone, but especially SÃ¼leyman) . We would definiteley stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, affordable, great location”
Reviews.Author: SalNToronto
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Empire Palace is conveniantly located in the heart of the old city. Only a few minutes walk from the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns, etc. The Tram runs right in front of it which is very useful for visiting any place outside of walking distance. Positives: Easy pick up and drop off to airport Great location Next to many nice restaurants and shops 5 minutes from the main historical area and 10 minutes from the Grand Bazaar Courteous staff Clean and well kept location Good breakfast Negatives: Rooms a litlte small if you travel with 3 people I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in a well kept hotel with a great location. My thanks to the staff for making the stay easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: AlinaPN
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at BW EP, as it was ideally located in the old city with tram 50m away from the hotel and with major attractions walking distance from the hotel. Also a big plus was that the best cafeteria in town (Mustafa Hafiz) was just around the corner, offering the best turkish sweets we tried in the city. The hotel was comfortable, with a very helpful staff. We wanted a bigger room with a larger bathtub and the request was met promptly. We stayed at the 5th floor, which is probably the best floor, but being right under the kitchen we had some trouble with the daily morning noise and glass breaking routine. We tried the breakfast one time, but was not the best motive for getting up in the morning considering all the great places around the hotel which offered delicious cheap turkish food. Overall was a nice experience for being in Istanbul for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, good value”
Reviews.Author: Rob E
Reviews.Content: Close to many sights, shops, places to eat etc. Secure, comfortable room, nice bed. Staff are friendly, decent breakfast (should serve turkish coffee) with a nice view, quite a bit of street noise at night and early morning (tram right on the street) but it didnt bother me considering the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel indeed!”
Reviews.Author: bill42354
Reviews.Content: I was recently on a Christmas tour with my wife and young adult son and daughter. We began our tour in Istanbul where we stayed at the Empire Palace Hotel. I had been in contact with the manager by email and was impressed by her responsiveness. We were not disappointed when we arrived. The hotel is nicely located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, within walking distance of the Gulhane tram stop, eye-popping historical sites, and more shops than you can image (bewared the rug merchants!), and numerous delightful places to eat. Our tour of Turkey ended back in Istanbul and we changed our plans so that we returned to the Empire Palace Hotel; we liked it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ashgToronto
Reviews.Content: We had a quick 3night stay in Turkey and we wanted to make the most of it. This prime location made it very easy to walk to the blue mosque and surrounding areas. There is also a tram right outside the door taking you to the crystal palace and to the subway line. The rooms were average, clean and great for what we needed. Breakfast was included and although it wasn't anything fancy there is something there for everyone. My one suggestion would be to have the hotel arrange for a car to pick you up at the airport. The drive is quite windy to get there and a taxi driver could easily spin you around a few times to run up the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to walk from”
Reviews.Author: philatravelgirl_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a main road and easy to walk in 10-15 mins in any location to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar or the other way to the waterfront and the Spice Market, bridge and ferries. My room was a good size with a comfortable bed (i stayed free with BW points so i was in the smallest room category). My only room complaint was that I was in the front of the hotel so that I heard the trolleys go by until 11-midnight and started at 6 am - also the call to prayer however, I was only there for one night. If longer, i would request a quieter room. I ate at the hotel restaurant choosing to sit outside - the food was very good as well as the local Turkish wine. Service was great and loved the free wi-fi. I stayed here pre-cruise, enjoyed the breakfast included and thought that the staff was attentive. I had two taxi issues both were addressed by the manager onsite and via email.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, smoking policy is a bit shaky”
Reviews.Author: Johanet
Reviews.Content: The hotel cannot be faulted on location, the trolley stops right in front of it and takes you down to the old part of town in a few minutes. The general atmosphere and decor of the hotel is pleasant and the staff quite friendly. We specifically asked for a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor and we were assured that that is what we got. Our room however was one of those where an interleading door could be opened to the next room to create a family suite and our neighbours smoked up a storm in their non-smoking room on the non-smoking floor. We complained to the reception desk and was moved to antoher room. I would however rather have preferred that the disrespectful crowd next door were told to move it to a smoking floor. I didn't really feel like lugging my suitcases to another room at 1 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rhea D
Reviews.Content: Beautiful interior, pleasant and friendly people and services. Trolly stop 1 block from the front door. Close to museum, Orient Express Train Depot and Egyptian Bazaar. View of Bosphorus Straight. Easy access to local shopping. LOVED the spice shop across the street, and the restaurant around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but make sure you get a room ate the back of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chrislea1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for all the major must sees in Istanbul and is well run. The only down side is that it is on the main street that has a tram system that runs both ways. With the high sided buildings it is very noisy when they are running. Having said that I suppose you get used to anything if you are there long enough. The breakfast is good with a selection of hot and cold including fruit, cereal, meats and cheeses and eggs. Overall it is good value for money but take ear plugs Justin case and ask for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barney12B
Reviews.Content: Good small hotel in a great location for sightseeing. The trams are literally on the doorstep but we were lucky to get a room at the back of the hotel so it was quiet. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable and the staff are very helpful and pleasant. They were happy to help in any way and responded to requests promptly. The buffet breakfast is not very varied but more than sufficient to start the day. We would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but convenient and well priced”
Reviews.Author: Funiculur
Reviews.Content: The double room was a bit small but overall quite a pleasant experience. The hotel is in a great location for the blue mosque and bosphorus and staff are extremely friendly and willing to help make reservations or recommendations. Only real down point is walls are a bit thin and can easily hear others in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qualitytraveller22
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 6 months before we arrived. When we pulled up at the hotel in the "hotel booked taxi" we realised there was something wrong when our luggage was kept in the taxi. When we entered the hotel we were advised by the manager that there was no rooms available. This was despite the fact that I had spoken to Lastminute to confirm that our booking would be honoured! The replacement hotel was sub-standard and resulted in me being given a refund by my travel company When you read reviews this has happened to other travellers booking this hotel so please be aware. I had no problem with the hotel when we eventually got into the hotel! Our room was on the side of the building which was fairly quiet. Please be aware that the front bedrooms face the main road and the trams are right outside! The restaurant is no more than OK. Would I go back, not certain because of a lack of trust with the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: aezzeldin79
Reviews.Content: I went there During my Summer vacation but really it was under my expectations. Please, Don't ever believe the Pictures on the Internet. The Restaurant is awful, No varieties. The waiters & waitresses are too sleepy.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ian T
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Istanbul and how lucky to have chosen the BW Empire Palace Hotel to stay. The hotel is superbly located in part of the Old City close to some of the key tourist attractions to visit,many within easy walking distance. An added advantage is its close proximity to the excellent and cheap tram system and a multitude of good quality restaurants serving traditional turkish cuisine.The hotel is well appointed and furbished in tradional stlye. Very nice bedrooms, albeit compact in size, and a good sized lobby area containing a bar. A great way to start the day is to take a buffet style breakfat in the rooftop restaurant with views over the Bosphorous. A very strong aspect of the hotel is the professionalism and friendliness of the staff. In particular, Ercan the receptionist was outstanding, and the Head Porter, and Suheyla, Guest Relations could not have been more charming and helpful. Overall, a great experience and a hotel I would thoroughly recoimmend to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mariana S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, the main attractions are few minutes walk away. Accommodation is very good, clean. The first night was cold in the room but after I communicated this to the reception and took immediate action. We decided that we will come back to this hotel. I recommend it with pleasure for a city break in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “October 2011 stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Got off to difficut start when room overbooked at stayed at Hotel Amber for first night - disappointment lessened by abundance of fish restaurants in that area. BW moved my things the next day and all else over next 3 nights was fine. Breakfast is rather modest but that's no different to most other hotels I've stayed at this year. PLenty of good choices in the area for lunch / dinner etc. Excellent location with caring and attentive staff. Would use this hotel again. Paul Tanner

Reviews.Title: “Got better and better”
Reviews.Author: hazel-paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of a tour of Turkey with friends. We didn't have a good start as our room smelt of stale tobacco (we had forgotten to ask for a non-smoking room). As the hotel was full we couldn't change rooms until the following day. The manager was very helpful and carefully wrapped our valuables and locked them in her safe while we went out for the day. Our room on the 5th floor was at the back -much quieter than the previous one which overlooked the main road and the tramtracks. The hotel was very central with all the major sights within easy walking distance. The rooms were comfortable with nice details that we didn't get in our other Turkish hotels -box of tissues, complementary bottles of water and a tea/coffeemaking tray with a small jug of fresh milk. One gripe -WHY do Turkish hotels insist on the awful brightly coloured orange squash at breakfast? Breakfast was disappointing on the first morning but had been transformed by the end of our stay thanks to the efforts of the manager and her staff. The staff were the best feature of this hotel but I do think they could do with a new chef -we were not impressed by the meal we had on the first night of our stay. There are several very good restaurants nearby with excellent food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaudenzio G
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. We didn't appreciated the overbooking. The first night we sleeped in another hotel (at the same level)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Best Western Empire Palace”
Reviews.Author: MUHAMAD IMRAN B
Reviews.Content: Hello I am Imran from Pakistan.I alongwith my wife and two daughters stayed at this mangnificent hotel from 22 July to 26 July 11.It was a memorable and fascinating experience.The hotel staff was very courteous particularly Mr Argan at reception who helped us great deal in planning our trips to different places. The hotel location itself is the best in the town as you find all major attractions like Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aaya Sofia and Spice Bazar at walking distance. The tram passes right in front of the hotel and is a very cheap and convenient mode of travelling around. On the whole we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel in Istanbul and will strongly recommend it for other travelers to this historic city.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Palace - excellent for seeing the sites”
Reviews.Author: Gillfranco
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in September for a brief holiday prior to going to Ankara for a business trip. The hotel is centrally situated and could not be better placed for tourists with all the main site sin walking distance. It is a small but well appointed hotel with good modern rooms which are clean and functional. The staff, without exception, could not have been more helpful or friendly. The restaurant food was of good quality - although I only had one evening meal as there are many other restaurants to temp you in the immediate area - breakfasts were the usual Turkish fare with a wide selection of items. Roof top restaurant ideal for looking over the City and the bay. Only one point stops me giving the hotel a 5 star rating - noise. Not entirely their fault, if you stay in a centrally located hotel on a busy street with trams running you expect that, but I thought that the insulation could have been better, although I was fortunate to be in a room at the rear of building over looking an inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Brett B
Reviews.Content: This review is way overdue, but I just wanted to add to the myriad other great review. We had a group of about 35 staying here and the staff made our stay very easy and comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the service prompt. We had a few miscommunications about some meal details, but the staff did a fantastic job of working through the problems to an acceptable resolution for all. They were extremely friendly and helpful and it made our fist experience in Istanbul a very memorable one. I'd especially like to mention Ergin, Ilkay, Ercan, and Kursat. They rock and were a blast to hang out with! Thanks guys, for all your hard work. I would definitely consider your hotel again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: proudtobeyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Could not speak highly enough of this hotel. The staff go out of their way to be helpful over and above the call of duty. They would not even let us carry a case. When we asked for tea making facilities it was there within minutes. When our pick-up bus was late, they noticed we had been standing outside ages and made a phone call to our rep for us without being asked. I asked for a quiet room and consequently got one at the back of the hotel, which was fine, you cant have it both ways, its a very noisy city! The location is superb, right by the tramline which goes through the heart of Istanbul so you can get almost anywhere for less than Â£1 It is almost opposite the Topkapi Palace and a short walk from the Grand Bazaar, the Basilica Cistern and the station. Everything was very clean and the excellent breakfast was served in the rooftop restaurant from which you can see the Bosphorus, the same view that the Sultans had long ago! I can recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: brianc906
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there and found the location very convenient for major sites. The staff were invariably friendly and helpful, especially so when transport to the airport was very late. Breakfast was fine and the room well-kept. One gripe: the drawer space was very, very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterlew42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you wish to visit the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, the Grand Bazaar etc. They are all within walking distance - though uphill. However, local transport, though crowded, is excellent. Altrhough my mobility is limited, I had no difficulties. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, and you had excellent views of the area around as the dining room was on the roof. We did not choose to use many of the facilities like the Turkish Bath so can't comment. The area abounds in excellent restaurants at very reasonable prices. Consequently we only dined in the hotel once. It was certainly not the best meal we had and we were there in Ramadan and were advised staffing had been affected. But there is just so many other restaurants that our advice would be eat elsewhere. While many may be aware of it we did not know that every restaurant was not licenced to serve fish - so you might want to check menues carefuilly if that is what you want. We would certainly stay there again! But note we are a couple in our late 60s - hot blooded younger folk may want something more oernate, flashy and lively. We however were very content with itrs peaceful, relaxing, well maintained comfort, and its welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Drford
Reviews.Content: Ideally located base for all the main sights, wonderfully helpful and friendly staff. Should be on the top of anyones list of where to stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “The view of the Bosporus from the restaurant on the rooftop,....”
Reviews.Author: TheIdiotandTheOdysse
Reviews.Content: .....the wonderful strong-fingered masseuse in the hamam in the basement and the delightful manageress Ceylan -- as well as the rooms and wi-fi in between -- make this an ideal spot to stay in iconic Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault!”
Reviews.Author: Izzi Y
Reviews.Content: A very well-placed hotel for those who want to see the city, with helpful staff and comfortable rooms. I expected noisier nights from room, but all was surprisingly quiet! Very difficult to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: cornmillgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for two nights. Our rooms were adequate and the bathrooms clean. We overlooked the front and side of the hotel which was quite noisy during the day but everything quietened down by the time we went to bed. The tram stop outside was useful if you wanted to travel to the Galata bridge area or across to the Asian side but otherwise everything is in easy walking distance. A lot is made of the roof top restaurant but the view is mainly of other roof tops and we didn't eat there at night as there are so many great choices around.The reception staff were helpful but we didn't spend much time in the hotel. If you want somewhere reasonably priced and central but don't need lots of fancy facilities this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay! I felt like I visited my friends!”
Reviews.Author: Marussya_G
Reviews.Content: I think enough was said below. We really enjoyed our stay! The room was a bit small but cosy, we asked to stay at the back of the hotel and didn't hear trams at all and only once woke up because of the mosque calling for the prayer. The service was perfect and any smallest request was immediately fulfilled with the smile! Breakfast was nice, I would only wish for a bit more fresh fruits. The water pressure in the shower was not very strong but that's really the only down point. The atmosphere is perfect and that's what values!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel, noisy and compact”
Reviews.Author: shawlen
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights, hotel located on the street of the tram line, the rooms near the street are noisy and shaking when tram passing by, also seabirds are noisy at night. close to empire palace, surrounded by restrautants, but the breakfast is poor room is small (even single bed room), genreal service, fit for short stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Its Class”
Reviews.Author: PLS20011
Reviews.Content: The view from the restaurant and the lovely service will be my enduring memories of this small, boutique hotel. The Empire Place is a short walk down hill from Istanbul's major sites and shopping. The rooms are small, but well-decorated. The bed was comfortable. The Turkish bath was refreshing and professional. The front desk allowed me to switch rooms immediately when I asked and my new room was delightful. The hotel attracts all demographics, but families seem to gravitate there, which makes for a vibrant atmosphere. The management is quite confident as they put info about how to reach Trip Advisor in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul through the Eyes of the Empire Palace”
Reviews.Author: KenTbilisi_Georgia
Reviews.Content: An exceptional hotel. Close your eyes, listen to the sounds, and it is like you are in the middle of Ottoman Istanbul. Excellently located. Facilities beautifully appointed, a feeling of warmth, invitation and friendliness. Staff are world class.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way round.”
Reviews.Author: dahlia0808
Reviews.Content: Inspite of it being the Holy month of Ramadan, we were accommodated in every way. Our breakfast was served on the terrace at 03:30 daily with a 100% personalised service. Our kind waiter Polat was always there to great us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Love the 1st visit, not the 2nd”
Reviews.Author: lorieeper
Reviews.Content: Everything wonderful the 1st time at this hotel. Everything was perfect. The RECEPTIONIST was wonderful. I can't not say enough good things about the 1st visit. The 2nd visit a few weeks later, not so lucky. The receptionist was still great .Many problems the 2nd visit, maybe the new manager, not sure. Asked for them to bring a pot of tea. I had to call again for the tea. An hour later I was brought a huge empty pot, no water (needs water testing could not use bath sink) I thought a pot of tea would have been made for me and delivered. The housekeeper entered my room when I had a tag saying "do not disturb". She knocked and entered without giving me time to answer the door. The bellman and receptionist were great. I left the hotel very sad. I really like most of the staff. I would like to return but afraid of having a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, located in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: joschijns
Reviews.Content: We have had a wonderfull stay, very friendly and helpfull staff. Located in the middle of the old city, within walking distance of highlights like Topkapi palace, Haya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar. The room was comfortable and clean, good food, good beds. We will surely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly welcome and the hotel is situated in prime position for visiting the tourst attractions.”
Reviews.Author: KulaWitton
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very attentive and helpful. The food in the hotel is excellent quality and superb value. The breakfast is served on the rooftop, overlooking the Bosphorous. The bedroom was clean and comfortable and free water from the minibar was most welcome as the temperature was near to 40c. Wifi available in the rooms but not password protected. The hotel is a traditional building set in the centre of the tourist attractions and the tram station is only a short walk away, for longer journeys.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, helpful staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: spiderbait
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and in a perfect location for sites, shops & restaurants. Unfortunately, on our second night in Istanbul I sprained my ankle badly & spent the rest of the week in the hotel room! The staff couldn't have been more helpful the night it happened and for the rest of our stay. Everyone offered assistance. This is a friendly place. You must try the Turkish bath in the basement. You'll never feel so clean again!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in an excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Krat0s
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed (the most important part of any review) excellent food and good service. Just don't assume that all the staff can speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: teddy2ad
Reviews.Content: Had a brilliant experience here, on first time in Istanbul. The staff were brilliant!!! They have the best masseuse we have ever been to. She is mustard! Ideal position for all the big attractions, easily reached walking.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: gunner2412
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay at this Hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist. Another very helpful member of staff escorted us to our bedroom and explained where everything was. The room and the hotel were very clean. If you want tea/coffee you have to request this as it is not automatically offered. You also have to asked for refills as these also are not automatic. There were a few small points which we found irritating. Firstly the complete lack of drawer space in our room, we had to keep various clothes in our suitcase., Breakfast is displayed from 07.00 to 10.00. Unfortunately, at 07.00 most of the breakfast items were not available, this can be a pain if you are booked on an organised tour with a set pick up time. Our final gripe is that on the first day we managed to spill coffee on the cloth cover on the tray. The dirty cover was not removed until day 4. Apart from these we found the staff to be very friendly, the hotel to be in a great location for sightseeing and shopping and most of all, the great restaurants that were in the immediate vicinity. We would certainly stay at the Empire Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT & WILL ONLY STAY THERE WHEN BACK TO ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: faouzi_bellili
Reviews.Content: the location was perfect, the staff ver helful, very good room, great breakfast with great terrace. Mr.Alihan the owner was more than helpful , friendly .....i my stay was really enjoyable GREAT HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: summer503755
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel it was a lovley stay the rooms were very clean the staff were very helpfull & polite the view from the terrace on the 6th floor is breath taking what more can i say about this hotel its just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but check your booking”
Reviews.Author: redforpluck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really centrally located which means that all the major attractions are within easy walking distance. The room was small but immaculately clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable.The staff were all really friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and they really went out of their way to make the stay enjoyable. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided on request and there are lots of bakeries nearby so you can buy lovely honey desserts to go with the tea. The breakfast is OK and plenty of it , and one side of the rooftop restaurant has a great view of the Topkapi palace , the other half is just the tops of buildings which are best ignored.My only real complaint is that there was a problem with our booking and we arrived in the evening to be told that we would have to spend the first night in a different hotel a few doors down. This hotel was not as nice and the room was of a poorer standard. After a bit of haggling they agreed to compensate us with a free evening meal which made up for the hassle. I have since noticed that this has happened to a few other people so I'd advise checking your booking.We asked for a quiet room at the back and got one but there is still some street noise but this is inevitable if you want to be this near the nmiddle of town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for 1st Time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler601
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delayed response but I can not say enough good things about this hotel. My fiance and I were traveling to Istanbul for the first time and we had a wonderful experience there. The staff was so helpful and the location was perfect. We plan on staying here again for our next trip. And a special thanks to Muammer for all his help!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, great location, lovely staff, very nice room.”
Reviews.Author: thewalkerhughes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Empire Palace in April/May 2011 and really enjoyed our stay. We were greeted by very the lovely Ercan and were looked after by the excellent staff throughout our stay, making us feel very at home and well looked after. Our room was spacious, light and clean, and overall quite lovely, though wouldn't have been ideal for light sleepers (which we aren't) as it looked out onto the main street with the tram. Trams do not run all night though, and light sleepers can request a room at the back. Breakfast was served on the top floor with views of Topkapi palace, the blue mosque and the Bosphorus, and was good, with lots of choice. The hotel is also situated within easy walking distance of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Archaeology Museum and the Bazaars so it's in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at this hotel just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Cafer_38
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time in this hotel. We were traveling with 2 small kids, so it was important to have a clean hotel and a good roomservice, and it really was. In the morning we had a nice breakfast at the beautiful restaurant of the hotel at the roof with a nice view on the Topkapi palace, the Aya Sofia en the Bosphorus. The location of the hotel is just perfect! Hotspots like the Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia and the blue mosque are on 5 minutes walking distance. Spice market about 10 minutes, also possible to reach by tram which stops very near the hotel. We relaxed in the sauna and hammam after a long day of walking in Istanbul, just perfect and every thing was clean and well. The restaurant of the hotel also has a good chef with all kinds of specialities and it has a bar with a terrace outside. The staff was really nice for the kids and we will sure come back! (to beat the manager of the hotel with backgammon (tavla) :) )

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigIan39
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Empire Palace, Excellent welcome from the staff despite a late arrival, the requested pot of tea was with us in 2 mins and nothing seemed to much trouble. Great advice from the reception team on shopping, sites and entertainment. Room was comfortable, excellent beds and relatively quiet despite the central location. The location was the best part - within walking distance of all the main sites and right on the tram-line which we used extensively to get around the larger city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian187323
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul during April 2011. The hotel itself is located in the sultanahmet district of Istanbul. It was a little bit difficult to find since the sign at the facade is quite small. As there are tram rails next to the hotel the taxi couldn't stop at the entrace. But finally we managed to find it... The hotel itself is situated in the centre of the old town of Istanbul. All famous sights (Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque, Bazar ...) are within walking distance. Shopping options can be found in Taksim, where you can get by the tram running next to the hotel within 10 minutes. Around the hotel are enough opportunities to find something to eat, from a costly restaurant to a cheap snack bar. The hotel itself is very clean, also the spacious rooms. Water is provided free of charge every day. Breakfast can be taken at the 6th floor with a beautiful sight over the golden horn. The breakfast is the only thing there that can be criticised. The variation of food is very small, the tables are dirty and it doesn't seem to be noticed by the waiters. But for a short coffee and a small bread roll it is sufficient. The service itself (especially the concierge -> special thanks to Ergin here) is very good. The people are friendly and always there to help. One last think to say here: Be aware that the hotel is situated at a (during daytime) crowded street. Also the tram is going directly next to the hotel from 6 am to 11 pm. It could be very loud (also if the windows are closed). Since we were on tour the whole day and used to some street noise that didn't bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated, clean, friendly and good value.”
Reviews.Author: SteveUK25
Reviews.Content: The weather wasnt kind but we had a good stay at this Hotel which is well situated for the main Istanbul attractions. The staff were all friendly and helpful particularly front of house (Ergin). The room for two adults and one child was small but clean and functional and we asked for and received tea and coffee making facilities. Good stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff, perfect location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: AmiraHarb
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the hospitable hotels I've ever staid in. The staff were so friendly! They even knew me by name and we are friends on facebook! Talk about immersing yourself in culture. The price was good and the location was perfect. They bent over backwards to make sure me and my group were satisfied. Thank you guys so much! Everyone must stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: troycoons
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the Empire Palace - great staff who were ALL incredibly friendly and helpful. Location is excellent, near Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Spice Market...good breakfast with a view of the city as well. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Family”
Reviews.Author: scgurl
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weeks holiday in Istanbul...We traveled with two children (10 and 3)...so we were a little apprehensive from the start. But found the staff and accomodations to be EXCELLENT!!! We arrived at the hotel at 3:00am and found out that our travel agent made a booking error...rather than turn us out, the staff found a room that would make due for the night. The next morning, the staff made our room change and took care of our luggage, so we could go and enjoy our day. The room was VERY clean and comfortable. We were very pleased with the spaciousness of the room...traveling in Europe a great deal, the room's size was a WONDERFUL suprise and we were all very comfortable in our leisure time in the room. The breakfast in the morning was good and there was a variety of items to select...even cocopuffs for my VERY picky 3 year old...so all were happy!!! The outside "patio/porch" was a great way to end our evenings. My son and I had apple tea, while my husband enjoyed a beer and a waterpipe. The location was GREAT!!! We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see and then the things too far, the tram was right there and we just hopped on and off right around the corner. The noise was not an issue and the trams stopped running at midnight...even my 3 year old slept well!!! The beds were very comfortable, so we were able to get a GREAT night sleep each night, the first night, we were on the back of the hotel and heard the 5:30 call to prayer, but I was able to go right back to sleep...the rest of the time there, I never heard it from my room...which made me a little sad :(. The staff was INCREDIBLE!!!!!!! "Ed" at the desk and "Q" were FANTASTIC!!! They were very friendly, helpful, offered advise and set up anything we needed...they played with our children and even stole a few kisses from my 3 year old. In the evenings, staff was outside and eager to bring tea, drinks and even threw in a few treats for the kids...they sat and talked with us, and even played a game of chess with my son!!! Although my daughter would not accept the many proposals for love...LOL...she enjoyed her time too. I have to give a shout to the Deja Vu next door....the food was great and the staff amazing too....the guys all interacted and made our time very memorable. We left there feeling like part of the family and I will recomend the hotel to my frineds and I will stay there again when I am in Istanbul the next time!!! To Eddie and the guys..THANK YOU SOOOO MUCH for a great time...

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jul27
Reviews.Content: I arrived after midnight but was met at reception by Ergin Akar who was full of energy, friendly, efficient and helpful. We stayed at the hotel for 3 days and the level of service was always the same, particularly from Ergin. You could walk to all the major sites in the old town from the hotel. The rooms were stylish, clean and comfortable. The hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfeck location with perfect sewice!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul2011293974
Reviews.Content: Looking for a nice, comfortable and pleasant hotel? Choose Best western Empire palace. Located in the middle of Istanbuls most cultural and interesting area. Nice view frem the breakfast-room at the top of the hotel and nice clean rooms. But best of all: a servise for you as a customer you must look long for other places! The receptionist can give you any answer on all questions you as a tourist have and they are there for you 24/7. I would recommend this hotel for all sorts of tours:-)

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel close to the major sights in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: MelbMick
Reviews.Content: My stay began well with the hotel's shuttle service (separate fee). The driver was courteous and friendly even after waiting an hour because my plane was a little late and customs a little slow. The two receptionists Ergin and Yavus gave excellent service during my stay. They were always helpful with information, patient and cordial. The room was a reasonable size and though I am often a poor sleeper and it faced a smaller street of restaurants I had no problem with noise. Nor did I hear the call to morning prayers. Breakfast was good value as part of the hotel price, offered good variety and had views that reminded me I was in a very old, historic city. My room was cleaned properly and unobtrusively everyday. A friend and I strolled up the street at midnight for 10 minutes on the night of arrival and discovered the next day we had been almost at Agia Sophia without knowing it. The trams are very easy to use. You simply buy a 1.75 TL (Turkish Lira) ticket at a machine before you enter the turnstyles, and place the token in the turnstyle slot, but for the local sights you can walk easily - Agia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapl Palace. Don't miss the spice markets. Do some homework beforehand on places to eat at night as you are in tourist central. Location and the staff make this a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: davidjrees
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice is almost all respects. It is ideally located in Sultanahmed and is just a stone's throw from the major tourist sites of Istanbul - Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque etc. The bed was very comfortable with a choice of pillows being a nice touch. The rooftop restaurant is very good with an excellent breakfast buffet and entirely adequate dinner menu. It also has superb panoramic views of the city and the Golden Horn. It seems a pity to have to mention the downsides. If you have a room at the front of the hotel, which we did, you will most certainly be woken up at 5.30 in the morning by the Muezzin calling the faithful to prayer at 100 decibels from loudspeakers just across the road. If you manage to get back to sleep after that, you will probably will woken up again at 6 o'clock when the trams start and which run six feet from the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: trina12348
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul and would like to say how much we enjoyed our stay at the Empire Palace Hotel. The hotel was in the best location to visit places of interest such as the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, New Mosque, Spice Market and the Grand Bazaar. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful and we would like to thank them for always having a smile on their faces and making us feel so welcome in this lovely city. The bedrooms were very comfortable and very clean. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a short stay and for those who want to be in a convenient place to visit all the sights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE IN EXCELLENT POSITION”
Reviews.Author: haroldhenley
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Empire Palace Hotel Istanbul. Our choice was for a good value hotel in a central position. We were not dissapointed. All the staff were superb. Friendly helpfull and nothing was too much trouble. Mr. Yaruz on the front desk made us very welcome and helped with recommending restaurants all of which were very good and not overpriced. The hotel and rooms were very clean. Bedrooms were compact and seemed newly renovated. The bath in our room was more like a hip bath in which you were unable to have a good soak, after a days sightseeing. Breakfast was served, buffet style, in the panoramic roof restaurant with a very good choice of hot and cold dishes. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the Blue Mosk, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Spice Market , Bosforas cruise ships and many others, none much more than 10 minuits distance. We would certainly recommend this hotel, especially at this time of year. In summer when it is hot it may be pleasant to be able to use a swimming pool or shadey garden, but this hotel has neither being town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmci43
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kept very clean and is well decorated. The staff could not have been more friendly or more helpful, particularly Ergin - the night receptionist - who made us feel at home when we arrived late at night and recommended some excellent tours for the following days. The room felt a little cramped with a large double bed and a single bed but was very comfortable. We found that the room got very warm during the night despite the radiators being turned right down but the quiet air conditioning unit compensated for this well. The hotel is well located, enabling us to comfortably walk to all the principle sights including the Topkapi Palace, the main Mosques, the grand Bazaar and spice bazaar. We even enjoyed the walk to and from the Galata tower. We wondered if the tramway passing the front door of the hotel would cause objectionable noise but, although trams could be heard, they ran so smoothly and not through the night therefore they were not obtrusive. In fact, the tramway meant that the hotel was easy to find again after being out walking.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: A3nnn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice personel and the location is perfect! The breakfast in the restaurant with the great vieuw is excellent. For a short stay this hotel is great because it is in the very close neighbourhood of all the culture places in Istanbul. Tram is near so if you do not like to walk you still can travel cheap

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: omidme2
Reviews.Content: There were 9 of us stayed for more than two weeks at this hotel. This was a family reunion at the home away from home. Very clean rooms, lovely breakfast & very friendly staff. Specially I want to thank Mr. Ergin Akar in the front desk along with the rest of crew. They were very attentive, friendly & helpful. No matter what you ask them, they drop everything to help you right away. You can not ask for more. We will definitely go back to this hotel and Thank You Best Western team.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with the best service and best Hamam in the city”
Reviews.Author: andremaha
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul and from the very start we found ourselves surrounded by the nice, kind and helpful turkish people. Our first impressions continued in the hotel, where we were warmly welcomed by the managers Ergin and Akar. During our stay in Istanbul these two people made our trip even more pleasurable and enjoyable. In the matter of minutes our every request was answered - be it the spa reservation, additional pair of slippers or general questions about the city. Breakfast in this hotel made every morning even brighter. Being served on the top floor with the beautiful view on Bosporus Channel, it consisted of so many things, that they barely fitted on three big tables. We have been trying to try all of it - but did not manage in our four days stay. One of the most exciting things provided by the hotel is hamam - a turkish bath and spa. The woman working there - Raya - can literally do wonders with her bare hands. The massages she provided were THE BEST and MOST AMAZING in our lives! And I should mention - we tend to go to different spa saloons in Europe quite often. Raya made us feel reborn every time. After the long distant walks around the city, going to hamam completely erased our feeling of tiredness. The next morning we were feeling fresh and motivated to go to the next round of site seeing. So once again - Raya - spa specialist of the highest class. We recommend to accept the service this hotel provides and try the most amazing massage in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful, Clean and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: andrewp8
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, shopping during the run up to Christmas. The Staff were invariably helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and to a high, marbled standard. We were very happy with the whole experience up to the point when our return flight was cancelled and we asked if we could stay an extra night. At this point the staff went in to overdrive to help. Reception spent 45 mins trying to get through to the BA office on our behalf. The managers office / PC was handed over for an hour to search for alternative flights and print out information sheets. Staff were calm and nothing was too much trouble. Even if you dont get straded with cancelled flights this is a great hotel in an ideal location to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Falch
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the old town - just of the walls of the Topkapi Palace. Within walking distance of Ayhia Sofia, The Cisterns, the Blue Mosque, the Spice Bazar and the Grand Bazar.Tram just outside takes you to the new part of town, accross Galata bridge. Some noise in the street at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jrt1981
Reviews.Content: Good value, great location, great staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were welcoming, efficient and helpful. We thought that Ergin in reception went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel is in a great location - within easy walking distance of the mosques, The Grand and Spice Bazaars, restaurants and the Bosphorus River. Given the staff friendliness and location, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: bwie_sg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with both my husband and my mother-in-law. My mother-in-law opted for the spa services of which she visited more than once and gave positive feedback. This hotel is in a great location being within a short walking distance to the major attractions of Istanbul and having a tram station within about two minutes walk. This was a definite plus point. The view from the breakfast area gave a fantastic panorama of the city of Istanbul's attractions. Breakfast itself consisted of a continental buffet of typical Turkish fare including olives, cheeses, cured meats and etc. Great for those who like this type of breakfast but probably not recommended for the type of tourist who wants to wake up to a fry up of bacon, eggs, sausages and the likes. The staff of the hotel are friendly and willing to answer your questions at any time of the day. The person in charge even offered to lend us his map of the city free of charge. However: The price of food at the hotel could be considered ridiculous. Be prepared to pay around $75 (USD) for two plates of cold dips, some soup and three soft drinks at lunch time. I would not like to begin thinking about how pricey the meals at dinner time would be. The price of food in other establishments around the, exceedingly touristy, area is comparable and not of much quality to rave about (foodies' nightmare). One of the most striking factors is that the menu prices seem to be written on by hand, possibly indicating that different prices are given to different guests? There is no kettle in the room so that guests can make tea or instant coffee for themselves. A saving grace was the cafe/bar across the street where we could get some English breakfast tea or freshly ground coffee for a reasonable price. The walls in the hotel allow for telephone rings and conversations to be heard clearly from your next door neighbors; which disturbed my sleep due to my neighbors being the types who engaged in intoxicated discussions from 1am to 6am. During our stay, the water supply in the hotel was disrupted for about four hours one evening. In all fairness, the staff did do their best to get the service up and running again as soon as they could. I am not sure if hotel water supplies are a problem in Istanbul in general or it was just my fate. Either way, I have no lasting impression from this average chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: vjb44
Reviews.Content: Really close to archaeology museum and Topkapi and main station and the water front... and the shops

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, "extra friendly" staff”
Reviews.Author: Giddu2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is brilliant. Makes it easy to access all the key sight seeing destinations in Istanbul. There are several shops and eateries around the hotel. The tram runs just outside and takes you from one end of town to the other! Hotel staff tend to be "too friendly" - we felt uncomfortable with that. Breakfast is good in the rooftop - but if you are vegetarian all you will get is fried peppers and cottage cheese!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Old Town!”
Reviews.Author: bowrain
Reviews.Content: We didn't know where to stay in Istanbul, Turkey, so we decided to take and chance and try the Best Western Empire Palace. WHAT A FIND!!! Excellent location, great service, friendly staff and great rooms. This hotel is located right next to many streets lined with plenty of restaurants right outside it's doors, along with many lounging couches to relax afer your busy day of sightseeing. It is located on the street where thei main trolley is on, which makes it an easy access to many famous sites. This Best Western is a boutique hotel and would definitely stay here again next time we are in Istanbul. I would suggest this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Central and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled68
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week at this hotel and would recommend it. It was central to all the main sites in the old city and close to the ferry terminal. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable and the sheets were changed on a daily basis. The breakfast was excellent with a good choice of foods. If we go back to Istanbul we would stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimg2247
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights just to see the usual sights. The hotel was comfortable and very clean with very helpful staff especially Ergin and Erkan for who nothing was too much trouble. They serve a breakfast in the rooftop dining room with a wide selection of food. All the major sights are within a few minutes walking distance with lots of reaturants on the doorstep. We would defeintely stay here again if we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and such friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Parawaki
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at this hotel. When we arrived the receptionist and porter were so friendly and continued to be so throughout our stay. The breakfasts were good. We will certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Fredric69
Reviews.Content: Very serviceminded and helpful staff, especially Ersin and KÃ¼rsat - thank you guys! The location is perfect; walking distance to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Grand Bazaar. Breakfast on the terass at the 6th floor with a nice city view. The best of all is to hang out in the evening in the sofas right outside the hotel just watching people, drinking beer and smoking water pipe. The rooms are nice and clean. New towels everyday! We would definately stay there again next time in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jnloakley
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very comfortable and the staff extremely helpful and friendly . It was in a very good position for site seeing. Two of us had a Turkish Bath at the hotel which was most enjoyable. The breakfast buffet was delicious with plenty of choice. We shall definitely stay here again when we next visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a 3 day stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SandKP
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days/3 nights here as part of a two centre holiday in Turkey. The Empire Palace is not a boutique hotel it is not business class. However, it has great staff (particularly Ergin on the front desk) is spotlessly clean and serves a hearty breakfast in the roof-top dining room. You can reach all of the major sights within a 5 minute walk, and there are restaurants of all qualities all round the hotel. The sofas outside are the perfect place to soak up the atmosphere and watch the world go by. I would have no hesitation in staying here again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit - better than ever.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseBlackburnUK
Reviews.Content: Travelled solo last year and was looked after really well. This time with two friends. Excellent location, super service from Ergin and the gang, lovely breakfasts on the rooftop especially the rose petal jam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: rpbracher
Reviews.Content: It is easy to provide good service when all is going well. The real test comes when problems arise. It was NOT Best Western that let me down, but the airline I was booked with. ERGIN AKAR was very helpful. He first of all contacted Turkish Airlines so that I could make alternative plans and then helped with the translation. Without him, my wife and I would have been "lost." He is both friendly and professional. He is a credit to himself and to his Employer. The other members of staff were also "first-class!"

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mommye
Reviews.Content: Convinient location, friendly staff. Front desk Ergin Akar very friendly and profesional. Walking distance to a lot of places. Good value for the maney. LOVE there breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Small & cosy with good service”
Reviews.Author: bjorn83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a business trip with a colleague. Istanbul is not the best place during rainy December, which of course effected the whole experience. But the hotel always felt warm and welcoming. Considering the good price and a small hotel - I did not expect this - I expected less service and less engaged staff. Others have mentioned the good service and I can only agree. Very informative and friendly staff, especially the reception. POSITIVE + Excellent service. + Nice rooms. + Clean. + Nice lobby bar. + Great location. NEGATIVE - Breakfast was not varied. - Loud sound from corridors. - Not much of a selection in the restaurant menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location and lovely staff! You couldn't ask for more!!”
Reviews.Author: CHOCOLATE2010
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the Heart of Istanbul, its location is perfect within walking distance of all major historical, cultural and touristic attractions of Istanbul like Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. Very clean at all times and good selection of breakfast in the mornings. Just a few steps away from the hotels door there is a station of the tramway, which is a fast and easy transportation to any part of the city. This was very convenient and was not irritaing at night time as one would assume. Surrounding the hotel are many local shops including resturants, convenience stores and jewellery shops. The staff were helpful at all times especially the receptionist Ergin Akar who were very informative and his english was good!! If one is to stay at the Hotel then you must have a turkish bath as this was very relaxing and the lady who gave us the bath was absolutely lovely!! Would definately stay here again and would recommend to all. Thank you to all the staff for making us feel very welcome and making our first visit to Istanbul a very memorable one SJ et al.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, excellent location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: rizarnp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Istanbul, within walking distance to historic sites. Helpful, friendly staff, especially Ergin Akar, who assisted me on short notice with transportation from the airport, and whose English was excellent. The free breakfast was very good, with an abundant spread of hot and cold foods, well prepared,

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, quality service and food”
Reviews.Author: OZHotelier
Reviews.Content: As an international hotelier myself, I have a discerning and critical eye and high expectations. This extremely well located hotel exceeded my expectations. From the gardener (on his break) opening the taxi door and carrying the luggage, to the Front Desk greeting, to the room cleanliness and ambiance, it was a pleasant experience immediately. The quality of the breakfast food (incl. with the room price) and the waitperson's service on 1st morning was way above that anticipated for a hotel of this rating. Unfortunately waitperson on 2nd morning let the team down. Used this hotel as initial Istanbul hotel before moving to Hotel Conrad to join a tour. The service stds at Best Western in the main were equal to that of the 5star Conrad. Congrats to GM/Owner and his team

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience I have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: Ken1949
Reviews.Content: I have travelled throughout the world and my experience at this hotel was the best ever. The staff was very friendly and helped make our 5 days in Istanbul so memorable. At the end of our stay most of the staff saw us off to our taxi and it seemed like we were leaving old friends. The location was great near most of the tourist attractions. There were many reasonable restaurants with excellent food within walking distance of the hotel. The morning buffet at the hotel was the best I have ever had at any hotel. I would recommend this hotel most highly if you are ever planning a trip to Istanbul Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Yamini1410
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Istanbul and its been one of my best vacation. One of the primary reasons for the same was the excellent services and advises provided at my hotel. Its prime location and access to all places was an added advantage. Just loved the garden restaurant of the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: tom186338
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, especially Ergin Akar on reception, Firat Sulun and Ilkay Auci [service staff] and Muhammer Serbest in the bar. Room was small but clean and adequate for a short stay. Breakfasts were good. Gin and tonics were generous.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for more!!! Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paragkash1
Reviews.Content: Hello from Paragkash>>> This is an Ideal location, right in the middle of all the attractions at Sultahnahmet. It is just opposite Gulhane Tram stop, one stop before Sultanahmet. 3 minutes from Topkapi Palce, 5 min. from Basilica Cistern (Yerbatin Sarai), 6 min from Aya Sofia and 10 min from Blue mosque. We also took tram from Gulhane to last stop Kabatas for Domblabache Palace(15 min pleasant ride) I was traveling with my wife and 2 teenage daughters. We booked a triple room with an extra bed for 3 nights and got a complimentary airport pick-up. They also give complimentary Tea- Coffee supply Electric kettle, an Iron with ironing board. The breakfast on the terrace restaurant is sumptuous, varied and filling. They had Juices, Milk, Tea, coffee, Salads, breads, cakes, Eggs, Honey, cornflakes etc. They even arranged an early breakfast at 5.45 am specially for us when we had to reach the airport. They called a taxi to the airport which was quick and reasonable at 35 Euros. View from the terrace is nice. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Tram running from front of the door is not a nuisance. We never had the noise problem. The lobby, restaurant and room ambiance is good. Turkish bath for 30 E is very relaxing and rejuvenating. Overall package is very impressive and quite reasonable. It is excellent' just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: robbo8976
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 5 night stay at the empire palace. Our room was newly decorated and spotlessly clean. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff they were helpfull and friendly and made you feel part of the family. The Breakfast choice was varied and more than adaquate. We were in a front room at the hotel and would like to say that the tram noise is absolutely no problem. A great location for exploring the old city, all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: GerryMandering
Reviews.Content: There isn't really much I can add to what has already been said. Excellent staff, excellent location, clean and modern rooms (though admittedly a little on the small side, but then how much time do you spend in the room?). Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, lovely friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: martythesparky
Reviews.Content: Really excellent location for sight seeing, nice comfortable hotel - not too big to be impersonal, lovely helpful and friendly staff. Rooms comfortable, nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with the service that we received from all the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: lluent
Reviews.Content: Last Easter, my sister and I stayed at the Best Western Empire Palace hotel in Istanbul for five days. We were very pleased with the service that we received from all the hotel staff. We were particularly grateful for their help with my sister, who had a big problem with her knee and was unable to walk. They all did as much as they could to help, and always with a smile. We hope to one day return to Istanbul and of course to the Best Western Empire Palace hotel, where we very much enjoyed our stay, even though we had that unexpected health problem. Riba sisters

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, central for all sightseeing with very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: walkaboutEssex
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the hotel, even had free bottlled water in the fridge. Staff always willing to help and suggest ideas. The hotel was ideal for visiting all the sites and there was a tram stop opposite. Would thoroughly recommend going to a Hamman (turkish bath) and there was one just round the corner - we were a little tentative about what we would find but need not have worried as the staff were most kind and helpful and we really enjoyed the experience. Would really recommend Istanbul as a short break destination.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice located hotel very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: szaborenata
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 5 nights in May- it was our honeymoon and we had a great time. The hotel was clean and it is in walking distance of the main sights. they helped us enjoy istanbul so much. Argin the recepcionist helped us a lot but the waiters were very nice too. We will recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to visit istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location and best staff”
Reviews.Author: EChunTaite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here twice in April. Once planned for 3 days, then again when stranded by the Iceland volcano for 5 days. Great location within walking distance to major historic sites in SultanAhmet. Friendliest staff ever, especially front desk, housekeeping and customer relations. When we were stranded and needed a place to stay at short notice, they welcomed us back like old friends and treated us accordingly. Most helpful dealing with the details of an unexpected stay! I was especially impressed that they did not try to "profiteer" from the crisis. Special thanks to Ceylan, Reservations Mgr and Ercan, at Front Desk. We'd happily recommend the Empire Palace to all our friends. Edmund Chun Taite. ps. we tried to send a review from the hotel during the crisis but it may not have gotten through.

Reviews.Title: “Immense help despite flight delays”
Reviews.Author: Lungipiedi
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Istanbul for 6 extra nights owing to the flight delays caused by the volcanic ash cloud. We had to change hotels and this one gave us sanctuary at short notice for one night and extended it to six nights by necessity. The hotel has a good location, we had a good rate, an excellent room and the staff were extremely helpful in our predicament of being unable to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy nightmare”
Reviews.Author: designtiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights due to the very good reviews on booking.com and tripadvisor. Unfortunately, these are not coinciding with our experience. The hotel is on the main road in the old town of Istanbul and thus conveniently located for the sights. Most guests would stay between 1 and 2 nights max. which is probably as much as one can endure without (a good night's) sleep. This is one of the noisiest locations ever with trams passing, restaurant visitors cheering, generators running, guests talking/arguing in hotel corridors, bathroom noises at least 20/7. We stayed at both side/front and back rooms but there is simply no chance one can escape the noise anywhere in this hotel. Rooms are run-of-the-mill and rather dated. Cleanliness is o.k. Service is friendly enough and trying, but.... Breakfast is a basic and uncharitable affair not to be compared with other hotels in this category. Expect to pay extra if you want a decent cup of coffee. Steer clear of other meals, e.g. dinner!! Using the awkward and messy Hamam/Sauna area in the basement is charged at â‚¬20 extra and absolutely not worth it. Prices are on the expensive side for the standard of this hotel which by no means is a 4 star ! Bottom line: If you can't avoid a stay make sure it's a short one - otherwise it will ruin your most precious time.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Istanbul, 1st to empire palace and wouldnt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: BusheyitesLottie
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul last year and stayed at a neighbouring hotel which wasnt anywhere near as good as this one. The staff were wonderful- extremely friendly and helpful. In fact we felt that nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast, taken on the terrace, with view of the Bosphorus, were good and the rooms were bright and pleasant. The location is very good, being within walking distance of the river, the tram line, the park and all the major sights of Sultanamet. It may not be the most glamorous of all the hotels but we wouldnt stay anywhere else!!
