Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great, city-centre location”
Reviews.Author: LeoDorking
Reviews.Content: When stranded in Istanbul due to the volcanic dust cloud, what joy to get such a warm welcome at this small hotel in the very heart of the old city. In midst of all the flight chaos, Mr Akar on reception calmly managed to conjour up a very pleasant family room for us and he and all the staff were excptionally helpful and friendly to all the stranded travellers. This hotel is in a very convenient position for sighseeing, just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and other important sights. The downtown location means that it could be noisy. with trams and restaurants all around, However our room was double glazed and there was air-conditioning (which we didn't need in April) so we slept well. Good breakfast served on the 6th floor and an open-air restaurant at ground level, full of brightly coloured rugs and cushions and staffed by cheerful, friendly waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Do stay here if you are visiting Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: BritishFlyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a boutique hotel with seven rooms each on five floors. The dining room is on the sixth floor and has a restricted view of the nearby park and Bosphorus - watch for the cruise ships turning around early in the morning! The hotel is ideally located for the major local sites (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar) and the Bosphorus itself is a 10-minute walk away. There is a frequent tram service literally just outside the front door. (Because of this, it was a little noisy in our room, but we did get used to it after a while.) The buffet breakfast was substantial with a wide choice of hot and cold food. Free cakes and pastries were served with tea/coffee between 4.00 and 5.00 p.m. in the ground floor lounge each day. The evening meals at the hotel were absolutely first-rate, beautifully cooked and presented. We had a triple room on the 4th floor and like the rest of the hotel, it was beautifully furnished. It was spotlessly clean and the cleaners were always friendly and willing to please. The towels were changed daily and the bathroom was regularly re-stocked. It was recommended not to drink the tap water, but two half-litre bottles were provided daily. A kettle with tea/coffee/milk was also available on request for use in the room. A Turkish bath and spa/massage facilities were available in the basement, but we did not use them. What set this hotel apart from the rest (and that includes 5* hotels) was the genuine warmth and excellent service from every single member of staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff on Reception and in the breakfast room were always helpful and ready to give advice. We happened to be there for an extra four nights because of flights being grounded due to the volcanic ash cloud from Iceland. Ceylan (Asst. Manager) went out of her way to help us in any way she could. Leyla (Customer Relations) was always cheerful and helpful. The owner himself, Mr. Akkoc, also tried to assist us in getting home. We really did feel as if we were part of an extended family. So if you want to be treated well and made to feel really welcome in Istanbul, this is definitely the hotel to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel in perfect location with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SigurdJorsalfar
Reviews.Content: My wife, my son and myself all liked the Best Western Empire Palace Hotel in Istanbul very well. The three-bed room was nice, the room cleaning good, the daily breakfast well-made and the staff all had a very friendly manner. Add to this the fact that the Empire Palace Hotel is ideally located for a tourist's view of Istanbul, with must-see sites like Topkapi, the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DJWLJW
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend (3 nights) in Istanbul, and stayed at this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. The hotel is nice and central and within walking distance of many places of interest. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms very comfortable (if a little on the small side). The staff were very friendly - in particular Kursat. Tips - lots of places are closed on a Sunday - a number of good restaurants within a short stroll from the hotel....oh, and a pub on the corner with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service-fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: amanda072
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived,everyone in the hotel was very friendly and curteous.In particular Kursat. The rooms were a little bit on the small side but immaculately clean. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the ancient part of Istanbul on foot. with excellent public transport facilities for trips further afield. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our stay so enjoyable. We"ll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - charming service”
Reviews.Author: travelerCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, and the hotel was great to stay in. We really enjoyed the very friendly and charming staff, and the roof terrace has great views. The hotel is very centrally located in Istanbul, a short walk from the historical sights. The street is a bit too touristy for our tastes, but that is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: reishein
Reviews.Content: Our 6-day trip to Istanbul was made even more enjoyable by our stay at this hotel. Perfectly situated, within walking distance of several highlights such as Topkapi, Hagia Sofia and Sultanahmet Mosque, a tram stop just around the corner and the friendliest staff we've met in a long, long time. Given that my husband has to use a wheelchair for long distances, we are sort of a 'special needs' couple. The hotel itself is not particularly wheelchair-friendly (steps to the front door and a rather small lift) but then again, neither is Istanbul. A flat tyre on day 1 was quickly repaired through the intervention of the staff, for which we are eternally grateful! The rooms are clean and will kitted-out, but can be a bit noisy if you wish to sleep with the window open rather than use the AC. Our beds were on the (very) hard side, which maybe isn't for everyone. Breakfast was great with an array of breads, meats, cheeses, cereals and so on (olives for breakfast! Who knew?)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel and a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: simon1984
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in Istanbul for 5 days. First of all the city itself is amazing. The hotel is situated in a very nice part of the city and close by all kinds of cultural sights such as the great bazar. The hotel was very neat, clean and great service indeed. The staff was helpful to us at all times and really made our stay one never to forget! teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim! And I will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “I very liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_Atayev
Reviews.Content: I spent in this hotel five days! It was my business trip to Istanbul!! Hotel is very nice and clean! Service of the restaurant is very good! I liked the food! Location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: brizzey
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Empire Palace for 4 nights. The hotel is so well kept and so beautifully clean you cannot fault it. The location is perfect with a short walk to The Bosphorous and the Agai Sofia etc. There are plenty of shops and restuarants and shops around too the tram stop is basically outside the hotel. Lovely staff and breakfast is great including some hot items like tomato and cheese, eggs boiled or scrambled and sausages along with all types of breads meats cheeses fruits and cereals . There is plenty on offer and all done with a nice morning greeting and smile. The rooms are very cozy and beds are comfortable with a pillow menu if you need . Bathroom was spotless as was the entire hotel. Would and will stay here again on my next trip to istanbul that is a must Oh and free wireless internet in all the rooms was fantastic and a good speed too

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly Stuff!!!”
Reviews.Author: anya_slc
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i ever stayed... Very nice and clean place! Me and my friends deff enjoyed staying in this hotel, and we will come back for sure! Location is great close to Topkapi and to the Grand Bazaar. They have the BEST beds, really comfy and pleasure to sleep. The breakfast buffet is more than good! Thanks to the staff that made our stay most enjoyable and memorable! The ever friendly, nice nad helpfull Layla.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bloodworthtmc
Reviews.Content: This is a high quality four star hotel, in a very good location in Istanbul's old town, close to many major tourist attractions and transport links. The hotel staff all took very good care of me, taking care of all my requests. One of the staff in particular was incredibly helpful and took the time especially to help me find some classical Arabic calligraphers and information . Thanks to him I have a deep impression of how thoughtful, considerate and fun the people of this wonderful country are. I enjoyed my stay very much and would like to say a particular thank you to Mr Ercan Kaya for helping a tourist gain so much from this fascinating country.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JanDBergenopZoom
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. We were three (my wife, daughter and myself). We had room 407. This triple is not very spacious but offers all necessary amenities (such as: (most important:) good beds, safe, minibar, flatscreen, coffee/tea making fac., nice bathroom (not big either) with bathtub/shower). There is even a pillow menu from which you can select your pillows). The first night my wife had to get used to some street noise (trams passing by under our window), but after one night she was used to those sounds, including the early morning call for prayer from a nearby minaret (those calls for prayer can be heard all over Istanbul). Breakfast buffet is quite well. The service is very efficient and pleasant. The staff working in the lobby give you all kind of advice, make restaurant reservations, et cetera. The staff working in the breakfast restaurant give you a warm welcome every morning. The restaurant has views over the Topkapi Palace and the Aya Sophia Mosque. We did not have dinner (we never dine in the hotels we stay: we want to go out every night), so we have no opinion on the quality of the food. In short: we had a very pleasant stay in this hotel in which we felt really at home, thanks to the very symphatic staff.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Great Everything”
Reviews.Author: ESJMVMCK
Reviews.Content: I do not see how you can beat this. Great room, great location, and the price was good as well. The comfort of the rooms (bed, good shower, and cleanliness) was really high standard compared to most in this area. Great Turkish Bath as well and not bad for time and money. Just a walk away from everything. All the sites and Bazars right at a footstep. The only thing that was not the top star here was the breakfast. It was a little weak, but still much more than the normal. I guess it would have been helpful to know you could have ordered eggs. Did not find that out until the last day. That made the breakfast go up several notches. All the breads and meats were there so do not think it was that bad. Time was also good as it stayed opened until 10.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: KRAIMOVA
Reviews.Content: Empire Palace Hotel is the best place to stay! Hotel itself is very nice decorated! Rooms are nice and clean.Restaurant on the 6th floor has very nice view! Stuff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my staying”
Reviews.Author: JannatIsrael
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was the very best for the price! The rooms are spacious, the service is outstanding, the "full breakfast" was an amazing and delicious spread and the location is great.Our stay was wonderful in every way. Room was spacious and clean, with plenty of drawers and closet space. Staff was very friendly, especially the manager at the front desk. The lounge was a great place for our nightly wine and light dinner, including holiday time when restaurants were closed. I only wish we had more time to explore when everything was open. The hotel has a warmth that many of the sleek, very modern hotels don't. I will definitely return with my husband and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to dicover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Flibberscc
Reviews.Content: Empire Palace is a great place to stay in Istanbul, the location is perfect because all of the highlights of Istabul like Topkapi, Blue Mosque And Hagio Sophia are very close. And if you want to see other attractions, then you can easily take the tram because the station is almost in front of the hotel. The people of the Empire Palace are very friendly and always ready to help you. They arranged tickets for a big football-match for us and 'm still very thankfull for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive, accomadating and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SafarKazakhstan
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul, we enjoyed the location, walking and restaurants around the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful at every turn. We would certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The right place”
Reviews.Author: MerlinoRoma
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very good location near to Topkapi and S.Sofia. The staff is kind and i really advice this hotel to enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location! Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie92874
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Breakfast buffet was very good. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was so kind and helpful. They assisted us with all our questions. They helped us get our delayed luggage back. We really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: makenti89
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had an amazing time at this hotel during our trip to Istanbul at the end of November. The staff were very friendly, loved the customer service. The breakfast included a variety of turkish dishes. Added romance to our trip. loved it. Me and my girlfriend had an amazing time at this hotel during our trip to Istanbul at the end November. The staff were very friendly, loved the customer service. The breakfast included a variety of turkish dishes. Added romance to our trip. loved it.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBZurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and liked it very much there. Friendly staff, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff-a credit to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: moda_garcon
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff service was very good overall a very pleasant experience will consider staying here in the future

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Wonderful Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: twizzlirzzz
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the Best Western Empire Palace for 6 nights in late November and enjoyed every minute of our time spent at the hotel (not to mention Istanbul itself, which is wonderful). The rooms were spotless and charming, the complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent, and the location is fantastic. But the thing that made this world traveler post her first review on TripAdvisor was the genuinely friendly, warm and helpful staff at this hotel, which made us all feel like we were home away from home. Mustafa and Momi were particularly kind and helpful! If you're planning a trip to Istanbul, this is the place to stay -- without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “So much more than I could have expected.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinEsquire
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is beautifully decorated. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. And the hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of all of the tourist sights as well as countless restaurants. And I have to say that the hotel staff was wonderful. In addition to being extremely friendly, they were always eager to help us in anyway possible (whether it be help obtaining a forgotten piece of luggage or extra towels or water in the our rooms). In addition, several members of the hotel staff went above and beyond in making our stay pleasant; among them Ergin, Nina, Leila, Kerchat... and that is only to name a few. Never have a stayed at a hotel were the people are so personable, not just cordial to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently situated, value for money, well run hotel; perfect for a short stay in historic Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: VictorBridgend
Reviews.Content: If the art of running a successful hotel is the selection of appropriate staff, Mr Alihan Akkoc (pronounced Akkoch) has mastered that art. The 3 young men on the ground floor reception (Ercan, Ergin and Yaruz) were each equally welcoming, friendly, and efficient. Two vibrantly intelligent young ladies (Leila from Turkmenistan and Nina from Kyrgystan) not only prepared, cooked, and served our excellent meals but also cleaned the hotel to an immaculate standard-all in their spare time from their studies at Istanbul University. These "20 year old girls" are exceptional-they are both multilingual and are as interested in the guests and their satisfaction as they are themselves delightfully engaging. They wish to be ambassadors for their countries. We told them that they already are. The hotel itself is conveniently situated only a relatively short walk from the Hagiya Sophia/Topkapi Palace/Blue Mosque/Cistern area in one direction and the Spice Market/Galata Bridge/ Golden Horn area in the opposite direction. There are many decent restaurants around the hotel but the hotel's own top-floor restaurant is well worth sampling as it has a panaromic view and is excellent value for money. We stumbled across the hotel by happy accident. We would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone and would not hesitate to return. Our fascinating first visit to Istanbul was really enhanced by the whole experience of our stay at the Empire Palace which was excellent in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: XXXTravelGuyXxX
Reviews.Content: I never take the time to write these reviews because I always thought it was a waste. But, today I write it hoping that someone will read it and be inspired to stay here. I was very reluctant to go to Istanbul alone. I was going to be there only one night in transit to Zagreb, Croatia. I stayed two nights, one going to Croatia and one night returning. I was nervous being an American in a predominantly Muslim country. Not only was I totally impressed with Turkish Airlines, but I made a car reservation in advance. The car company (www.istanbulhotelstransfer.com) was amazing. As I came through the arrival doors, Bayram (my driver) was there waiting for me. greeted me with the biggest, warmest smile and welcomed my to his country, Turkey! Instantly, I felt at ease. He pulled the are around and loaded all of my things. As we drove from the airport to the city (about a 30 minute drive), he explained the city. Showed me the different building and their functions. It was a tour before I even set foot in the hotel!!!!!!! Freaking Awesome! Now lets talk about the hotel! when we got there, the porter (Paul) immediately met the car. By the time I could get out, Paul had already opened my door and unloaded all of my luggage. He was also already taking them to the front desk! When I was at the front, the receptionist (Ed) was so nice and welcoming. He answered all my questions BEFORE I EVEN ASKED THEM. I met a girl on the flight who was only in IST for 5 hours before her next flight. She came with me to the hotel and Ed (the front desk receptionist) took her back to the hotel on his way home after we toured the city! AWESOME! The room was a little small for me but, I was only there one night. But, when I returned a few weeks later, they upgraded me to a suite fot for a KING! Hahaha! I loved my whole experience there. The breakfast was a bit basic for American standards. I thought it suited their culture perfectly though. Plenty of bread, wonderful olives (all sorts), meats (all sorts), cheeses (all sorts), even bi=oiled eggs. A perfect start to my day. All in all, I highly suggest a stay here! The location is perfect! Once you step out of the hotel to the right you will hit all the major masques and to the left you will hit the water and all the splendors of the bustling city. The tram is 1 minute away and the main station is 5 minutes (walking). If you want more info..just email me. (xxarcadiaguyxx@yahoo.com)

Reviews.Title: “Location, charm and hospitality - a Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Skiptonians
Reviews.Content: A last minute decision to spend three nights in Istanbul en route from Northern Cyprus to the UK proved an excellent choice. A visit to Trip Advisor brought us to the Empire Palace. A tall, large former city house, situated in the old European quarter of the city, has been remodelled into the present hotel. On our arrival we were greeted in a most friendly and courteous manner - we felt completely 'at home' in moments. Our room, on the fourth floor, might have seemed a little restricted but, baring in mind the original nature of the building, it's central location in the old quarter and in comparison to the older hotels of London it was actually quite spacious. The entrance hallway to the room housed a large wardrobe, which also contained a safe - and how refreshing to find no charge or Deposit required for its use. There was a 'queen' bed and a single bed, although the room was occupied only by my wife and I; there was an armchair, writing table and small desk as well as a refigerator and flat screen TV. The en suite bathroom was modern, very clean and with lashings of hot water. We had anticipated a tea/coffee making facility but that semed to be missing, however a quick call to Reception resulted in the prompt delivery of all we needed - along with genuine apologies. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and we slept soundly, completely unaware of the tram traffic that we knew ran along the roadway in front of the hotel (and our room faced onto this frontage). When we drew back the curtains next morning we saw a minaret directly opposite! We had not heard the traditional calls and wonder whether it was nolonger in use; there are over 2000 mosques in Istanbul! Up two floors from our room and one reached the roof terrace restaurant, from which one could see the Bosporus and where we enjoyed our breakfasts and an evening meal. The location of the hotel boasts that, by turning right on exiting the hotel it less than 400 metres from the fabled Blue Mosque. En route one passes the Topkapi Palace, St. Sofia's and the Bysantine underground Cistern - all an absolute MUST for any tourist. Turning left and following the useful tramtracks a similar distance brings you to the terminous of the famous Orient Express railway, the Spice Market, another 'blue' mosque that turned out to be even better than its larger counterpart and the Galatay Brdge acros the Golden Horn. The Bridge is a 'double decker' - the lower section is home to a famous collection of fish restaurants - whilst up above pedestrians can hire a rod and 'catch their own'; there are evn locals with charcoal braziers ready to cook your fish for you! The old quarter abounds in restaurants and tea rooms - with their bubble pipes - do try the Green Garden beside St. Sofia, 200 metres from the Empire Palace. The acid tests of any holiday are 'would you recommend the hotel and destination to a friend?' - well, we've been home six days now and recommended it to lots of friends - and 'would you return?' - we travel extensively but would love revisit Istanbul and use the Empire Palace for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: RamblingBobSproat
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Best Western Empire Palace at the end of November 2009. The hotel is in a superb location within easy walking distance of Istanbul's most famous sights and also well placed for public transport. From the moment we arrived and indeed throughout our stay we were greatly impressed. The staff on the reception desk were extremely helpful and courteous offering useful advice and information and the reception area itself was both welcoming and comfortable. The standard of cleanliness in the hotel was very high. Although the room we stayed in was not particularly spacious, it was well appointed and was well suited to our needs. Breakfast was served in the restaurant on the sixth floor and we had a lovely dinner there on our final evening. Our waitress Leila was utterly charming and delightful. Indeed the hotel's greatest strength is the quality of its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PKSKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. It was in a fastastic location to see all the main attractions eg Topkapi Palace and Hagia Safia were within 10 minutes walk. All the staff, for example Ergin, were very friendly and helpful. They even have a Turkish Bath and sauna in the basement: my wife used this and said it was very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for independant travellers sightseeing in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kings1617
Reviews.Content: Pleasant Hotel in lovely old Ottaman house, easy walk to station and main tourist sights of Istanbul. Tram stop almost outside if you prefer not to walk. However, our room was on the front and we were woken early by the trams.Also there was some noise from other guests coming in late or leaving early. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, as were staff in the dining room. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, but this was excellent, with lots of choice. There are lots of restaurants nearby with a huge variety of menus and prices. The Hotel has a Sauna and Tukish Baths. Various treaments are available at extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here rather than any other hotel for both quality of service and the central location.”
Reviews.Author: ETypeV12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together two friends made our first trip ever to Turkey. Our stay was pre-booked at the Best Western Empire Palace which we had not seen and were not clear where it was within the large city of Istanbul. Our arrival was in the evening on a wet and dark night and we were met at the door with a most friendly porter and our bookings were very quickly processed to our two rooms. These were on the hotel frontage with a view of the main street the only minor drawback being the traffic noise from the tram service. The rooms provided were clean and most elegantly presented and we were provided with a complimentary in room tea and coffee making facility that was used each day. We took meals at the hotel on our first and last nights and two meals at on street restaurants during our stay. It must be said that the hotel cuisine was excellent but the two Istanbul restaurants left a deal to be desired!!! Perhaps we should have taken advantage of the hotel advice that if we wished to have quality then select one of their recommended restaurants who were running a door to door collection and return service - maybe next time? If you stay then look out for our young waitress/University Student in the restaurant "Leyla" who spoke fluent American English and who was most attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The location of this hotel is excellent as being somewhat slowed by knees that have seen better days it was not too difficult for me to walk to all the major points of interest. These were: The Blue Mosque, the adjacent large church/mosque that is now a museum, the underground Roman water cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Bazaar (this has been here since the 1400's and is too large to see in even two visits - be sure to direct your wives and girlfriends away from the main arcade which is aglitter with gold and jewellery!), and the spice bazaar (be sure to buy your spices etc here after a suitable haggle on price). In conclusion I am recommending this hotel to my daughters who I am sure will also appreciate the service that is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Incrediable hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zvezda_Turkmen
Reviews.Content: It was amazing time!!Hotel was so clean and comfortable,personal stuff was excellent.There was a girl Leyla she is from the stuff,which help us a lot! She was so kind and friendly.She made our trip unforgettable.We are all thankful to her!!! Now i know whenever I'll visit Turkey I'll stay in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can walk or tram to anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Albertab0und
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great value for the money. It was very centrally located. You can walk to all the main attractions, and you are also beside the tram. Lots of local restaurants in easy walking distance and a grocery store down the street. The in-house turkish bath was quite an adventure (highly recommend it). The staff were very helpful. The TV only brought in BBC news, but your in Turkey so why watch TV. The noise from other rooms, outside and the hallway is a bit loud, but not too bad. If you are staying longer there is no drawers for clothes, only a small amour to hang things. The business center downstairs is on a pay timer (and seems a little expensive....1TL per page printed). The free wi-fi in the rooms and common areas is great. Ergin at the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mmarx2603
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the old town, a handful of minutes from the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque - perfect for a first trip to Istanbul. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable. Breakfast - on the basic side. Immaculate Hamam and Sauna on site (albeit empty most of the time) - probably because of the social aspect it's supposed to be (the more the merrier). The tramline runs past the hotel and the station is literally 2 min walk. For a first visit, this hotel combines helpful staff, clean accommodation, a tad noisy if you are on the road side (but double glazing covers all of the noise). Air conditioning, multi-channel TV, minibar.. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keithhull
Reviews.Content: I was made very welcome at this hotel the staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was most comfortable. It is well situated in the city near many of the major sites and very close to the Tram stop I would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, shame about the food!”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Robin
Reviews.Content: We were staying close by this hotel and noticed the sixth floor restaurant from the balcony of our hotel. We decided to eat there on our last night in Istanbul, which happened to be a Sunday. What a disappointment! There was no one to meet and greet us in the restaurant when we arrived - one other couple dining - we ordered two starters - only one arrived - tinned mushroom soup! The main course consisted of frozen cooked vegetables, boiled rice and purportedly chicken Shish - the taste was awful and remainedin my mouth for some hours. What a waste of a spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location -- Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yachtcrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Palace for 2 nights and easily walked to all the tourist highlights from the hotel. The major highlights are uphill, but taking it slow, they were still just 20 minutes away. The hotel itself is on the tram line, so it can be a bit noisy during the day, but the trams do not run often at night, and we had no trouble sleeping. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was large for Europe. The staff was very willing to help us find restaurants and directions. I also had a facial treatment at the SPA and it was great and inexpensive! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: dollcups
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Friendly helpful staff. Clean and comfortable room. Hotel breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Only ate once in the evening at this hotel and the food was delicious. Quiet location even though it was a short walk into the city. Good location for walking to all the attractions centrally and the hop on bus tour was a good introduction to sights further afield. About a 15 minute walk to the bridge to cross into the Asian side of Istanbul to visit shopping area and other attractions. All the people we met were friendly and the bazaars were not as hectic as e.g. Cairo or Morocco. No problem finding good eateries in the evening. Watch the price of fish meals on the "bridge" as there is no set price so ask about the price before you agree as this depends on the weight of the fish. Hotel had a very good customer relations person who made sure we were OK and gave us extra information on where to eat etc. Mary Thoburn

Reviews.Title: “Kursat and Mami, very nice people”
Reviews.Author: blo20
Reviews.Content: Hi, We are a group of 9 friends from Spain.We have stayed at Istanbul last week during 5 days. We have not been at the hotel, but we have had a lot of fun at the terrace bar of the hotel. We have gone there almost each night because its attention was very good and we felt there very comfy. We want to greet to Kursat and Mami. They have taken care of us a lot. Thank you Kursat for your Nargile with milk and cherry!!!. Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and convenient hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SJHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Empire Palace for two nights at the conclusion of a cruise through Greece and Turkey. We were immediately made comfortable in the cosy lobby/bar while waiting for our rooms to be ready, and Berrin the concierge helped us decide on and book tours. We were travelling with two other couples, and we all agreed that the hotel was a great find. Each of our rooms were unique, but all had plenty of space and very comfortable mattresses. The people at the Empire Palace could not have been more friendly and helpful. We had a minor crisis when the airport transport scheduled by our travel agent did not show up, but the receptionist at the Empire Palace came up with a van to accomodate six of us and our luggage within 10 minutes! The location of the hotel is excellent. It is an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace, and the neighborhood around it is lively and felt very safe. The trolley tracks run right in front of the hotel, so there is some noise in the front rooms, but it did not disturb our sleep. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone planning a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAussieMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 13 day tour of Turkey, and found it the perfect location to see everything in and around Istanbul. It is within easy walking distance to many major attractions, or trams, buses, ferry's or metro are all easily accessible if you want go further afield. The staff were great and always responded quickly to any requests. Especially Ms Berrin Agil, on Reception, she is now my Turkish daughter, and I am her Australian Mum.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and honest staff. Thanks for a wonderful stay we will be back again soon.”
Reviews.Author: Sultannat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Empire Palace and it would have to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at for a long time. From the rooftop breakfast to the friendly staff. Clean and spacious rooms. Close to the tram and all major iconic sites. Ercan the hotel manager was very friendly, accomodating and very helpful with everything. Highly recommend you stay at the best western empire palace No.1 hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Felix18MiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within a few minutes walk of the Topkapi Palace and the Hagia Sophia the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Particularly Mr. Ercan Kaya one of the duty managers, whose English is excellent, helped us enormously. Most strongly recommended. Ian Burns

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Empire Palace”
Reviews.Author: SwitzerlandSteeles
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Istanbul to revisit some old haunts. We lived there from 1988 to 1992 and my daughter was born there. This was the first time we had been back since she was 18 months old and my son was 4! We were looking for a hotel that was right in the old town and close to all the major tourist sites as well as the ferry and train stations. We also wanted to avoid the plastic 5 star hotels that are the same everywhere and go for a hotel with a real touch of Turkish ambiance. The Empire Palace lived up to all our expectations with it's great location just around the corner from the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace - all within easy walking distance and also close to the tram stop. The hotel gave us adjoining rooms that connected so that we could be together as a family. The rooms were well appointed, clean and air-conditioned. The bathrooms were also spacious. What made a real difference was the pleasantness of all the staff who seemed as if they could not do enough to please. Special mention goes to Ergin Akar on the front desk who was always smiling and extremely helpful and spoke very good english. Other staff members were equally charming. All in all, our 5 night stay was thoroughly enjoyable in this magnificent city - helped by having a great place to stay with staff who could not have been more welcoming. Tessekur ederiz!

Reviews.Title: “amazing care”
Reviews.Author: gerdarica
Reviews.Content: Hotel Empire Palace in our room which is 304 is very comfortable and also personal has been very cooperatvie very friendly very efficient . We enjoy our stay here the breakfast is very tasty and they offer a lot of variety. The tours that we arranged are very cultural and interesting to see. We will definetly reccomend this hotel to our friends in germany and we hope to comeback Ä°stanbul in the future. Staff, service efficiency. Thank you Ms. Berrin Agil our Guest Relations treated us. Cultural travelling. Gerda and Erica Germany

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!! Highly Recommend for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: plumb757
Reviews.Content: The hotel was first class all the way. We were kindly greeted by the front desk assistant, Ergin Akar and were treated wonderfully by him the 4 days we spent there. He helped us get great tours for us, provided us with a map of Istanbul, gave us great information on the sites to see and how to negotiate when shopping at the Grand Bazaar. Thank you so much for all your help Ergin!!! You made our vacation stress free and extremely enjoyable!! We will Definitely be back to Istanbul to stay at ur hotel. The Best Western Empire Palace is very very conveniently located near everything including the tram/train transportation. The rooms are very clean inside, bathrooms are luxury, granite countertops & they offer all guests great breakfast every morning from the rooftop cafe of the hotel, great views up there. Excellent way to start your days in Istanbul. This is a great hotel and you wont be dissappointed. Thanks again Ergin Akar for all your help in making our trip excellent!! Mark

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlahaneXII
Reviews.Content: - The hotel is located in the heart of the old Downtown of Western Istanbul. - Near several historical sights and very accessible by tramway. - The staff is kind and always available and very kind. - At the reception desk, M. Ergin Akar was very professional and helpful and gave us good advices about touristic sights and how to access there.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in magical Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: travellerSouthamton
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. In particular Ersin Akar at reception spoke excellent English and was very helpful The location was ideal for sightseeing. If we returned to Istanbul we would be very happy to return to the Empire Palace. Our ownly negative comment is that unlike other hotels we have stayed in, we had to pay for use of the sauna

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BaldTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of quite a few really historical sites. The rooms are odd shaped since the hotel was once a palace but the accomadations are first class. The staff is helpful friendly and speak enough English to get by. The only problem is very few taxi drivers know where it is since it is located is the ancient part of Istanbul and the street is narrow is has tram tracks going down it. Parking is about a block away and one must unload quickly to not get in the way of the tram. The desk clerk was more than helpful and friendly and for the life of me I can't remember his name. But if he reads this write me on duncanparks@msn.com and I will certainly put his name in my reocomendation. I am sure he will remember me since not many big Texan's arrive wearing the national garb of Texas. Duncan

Reviews.Title: “1st class service”
Reviews.Author: chainreactionLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located, very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful in particular the receptionist s Miss Ergin and Mr akar Akar who went out of their way to assist us giving us useful information on where to go and where to dine. They both did their job verywell and set a good example for the Hotel industry in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: turci
Reviews.Content: Empire Palace family is the best! Their service is unbelievable, if you stay in Empire Palace you can feel yourself like that a queen or a king! Their housekeeping is the best! If you are staying in Empire Palace you can feel yourself like a part of their family. I want to reccommend this hotel , they highly answers your demands... I m glad to meet with Ms. Berrin Agil, she's the princess of Empire Palace! VIP employee, very important person, and unbelivable because she's working about thirteen hours everyday, and everytime she's smiling and happy! Mr. Abdullah is important person also, Ä± didnt understand what is his job defination, he must be a Bellboy but in my opinion he 's everything. Food and beverage manager of the Empire Palace Mr. Metin , he is very polite, he helped me many times , i want to turn Turkey again , because of Empire Palace Family!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: makhmalbobo
Reviews.Content: Pros of Istanbul: My hotel Ä±n Istanbul was one of the best parts of my trÄ±p. LÄ±vÄ±ng Ä±n U.S. has made my famÄ±ly and I more demandÄ±ng and therefore we expect a higher level of service. Our hotel has been a really great experÄ±ence for my famÄ±ly. This hotel had a frÄ±endly manager and staff that went out of theÄ±r way to make us feel comfortable. It was pleasantly clean and my family remarked that the towels smelled lovely and fresh. They had the best breakfast and to top this the staff gave us free bottled water, tea and coffee. Breakfast was served on the rooftop gÄ±vÄ±ng us a panoramic vÄ±ew of the entÄ±re city every mornÄ±ng. Cons of Istanbul: The Grand Baazar was expensive and the food inside was not very good. Avoid shopping and eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaretper
Reviews.Content: very frÄ±endly staff & helpfulh thank you so much especially fornt desk

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kellymimi
Reviews.Content: Best and lovely hotel that i stayed... Thank you so much, because you can stay eveyrwhere but cannot take good service ...

Reviews.Title: “okay for a night but generally disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dale_curtis
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews here, it seemed that this hotel was too good to be true....it's not. Ido wonder about some of thr comments on this site? Arrived with my wife and teenage son to be shown an utterly laughable room, no space for us or our clothes, only to be this was the best they had. Despite requests to the manager and the tour rep- no effort to resolve our probs and had to spend three v. uncomfortable nights there. The staff were okay , no more, no less. Breakfast just about acceptable. Turkish bath a bit rubbish. Just got the feeling that nobody cared that much. Pluses, great location. This is a hotel suitable for a business one night stopover, if you can afford the daft rates they quote!

Reviews.Title: “Although smal, friendly and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZIGGYKarlstad
Reviews.Content: They could speak english at the front desk. ItÂ´s not the usual habit in Istanbul. Although smal it is a very friendly and lovely place to stay. Whorth every TRY. We stayd four nights an we will certainly be their guests next time in Istanbul. Comfortable rooms, well decorated, nice top restaurant, the hotel is so close to what you have to see in town you could easily walk to the highlights. Try to get a room "upstairs" because the tram goes 3 m from the entrance so it could be noisy sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lumleymellenby
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located for all sightseeing. Charming helpful staff. All transport nearby. Good retaurants and shopping all around.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking little hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: saddleworthtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Grand Prix weekend so paid a supplement which made it less good value than it would have been normally but that was my fault for not avoiding the dates. As it happened the extra travellers in the city made it even more cosmopolitan and interesting. We loved the city and the people which was a real surprise as we expected far more traffic begging and letching. Everyone was charming and friendly in a really genuine way. The location was great right next to the Topkapi Palace gardens and given that it was on the main tram route it was easy to find our way home every evening. All the main attractions were a short walk away and easy to find. The hotel was very easy on the whole check in checkout process and the room was small but very charming. This is not a characterless Best Western it is Owner managed and all the better for that. Air con was not the best but that was our only problem. We were in room 101 which is a double - I think the twins are larger generally but we like to be cosy. They have coin operated internet access is the lobby which worked fine for checking in for our flight home and reception got us a taxi in 3 minutes for the trip to the airport. I think the taxi driver had been watching the Grand Prix though as he got us to the airport in 16 minutes!!! I have given 5 stars because of the whole ambience of the the stay this is a 3+ hotel in a good location but they deserve a good review because they made the whole thing completely relaxing. We have done similar city breaks in Budapest Prague Palma and Barcelona usually in 5* hotels and our number one requirement is usually location relaxation and a good breakfast and this one hit the marks.

Reviews.Title: “great value great employees”
Reviews.Author: tiger16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights while in Istanbul in May 2009. We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful , much more so than in more expensive hotels. The rooms were pleasant and quiet when considering the hotel is in the centre of the old part of the city. Breakfast was available each morning starting at 7;30 on the top floor giving one a great view of the city. The breakfast was excellent with a great variety of items. There is a superb turkish bath in the basement as an added bonus

Reviews.Title: “what could i ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: queenslandjohns
Reviews.Content: what can you ask from a hotel when you go to a city like istanbul?location?cleanliness?helping staff?getting the comfort and luxury you paid for?well i had it all from this hotel really...great location,staff striving to help,unexpectedly good quality at room and more

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Amazing”
Reviews.Author: bestlola
Reviews.Content: Their staff is wonderful, really amazing! When i wanted something from them, they always helped me! Front desk manager whose name is Yavuz Deniz , he has given us information about the city and i asked so much things, he was always calm down. Ms. Berrin Agil , she is working at the front desk also, her smiling face attractive , if you are unhappy in the mornings go to the front desk and see her! It will be enough for you to be happy. The hotel's location is very good, you can reach to everywhere on the historical side of Ä°stanbul! The hotel is arranging every Friday's Eve BBQ Party at the another Best Western Hotel, it has got lovely garden we like it. I come from Albenia , and I have many relatives in Ä°stanbul , this was my first trip to Ä°stanbul, it was a great chance to stay Best Western Empire Palace Hotel because when my relatives come to my hotel the staff paid attention to them! I reccomend this hotel for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “My Best Holiday in Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: taneresy
Reviews.Content: I always stay in Best Western Empire Palace in Turkey because of my business activities. Turkey is our neighbour, and hospitality in this hotel amazing! The rooms are clean , and comfortable beds, staff has smiling face everytime, I reccommend this hotel for everyone who wants to be relax and feel themselves like at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the single traveller”
Reviews.Author: TessSolihull
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Empire Palace. I was travelling alone, a single lady soon to be 80 years of age. The kindness and help I received from all the staff, especially Ozlem at the reception desk, would make me wish to return, if that was possible. The hotel restaurant was not available this early in the season and I was a little concerned about walking on my own at night to a local restaurant. Ozlem arranged for a member of staff to escort me to the restaurant and to collect me for my return to the hotel. I really couldn't have been made more welcome or treated more kindly. I'm so grateful and wouldn't hesitate to go back to the Empire Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money and excellent tourist location”
Reviews.Author: retirdprof
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the tram line (no cars allowed) street right next to the Topkapi Palace. The rooms are a bit small, not surprising given the location. Hotel was clean, nicely decorated and the staff were very helpful. Breakfast, served onthe top floor with a great view overlooking Istanbul, was included in the price and was buffet style. The internet is a bit spotty for rooms at the front of the hotel but OK elsewhere, including the lobby. We enjoyed our stay there very much and recomend this hotel to tourists wishing to visit the key sights in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, one could not find a better location, quality and comfortable room with the BEST service in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Adverturousone
Reviews.Content: These people made our trip and stay at this hotel flawless and spectacular: Yavuz Deniz, the front desk mngr., was completely understanding of what our needs were as new visitors to this complex city. He gave us the best price for the best room in the house and made us feel secure and completely at home. He was a perfect host! Berrin Agil, asst. front desk mngr., was lively and vivacious and filled with local knowledge about where to go and what to do to have fun and be safe. The night crew: Ergin Akar and Adem Canturk made our daily return to the hotel a terrific treat. They were filled with kindness and lots of humour making us fee, once again, right at home. The waitstaff in the restaurant, who assited us with the hooka pipe and cold Efes beer couldn't have been more informative and delightful! The housekeeping staff even brought us a pillow menu and respected our privacy when requested. This entire crew, both night and day shift were one of the best we have found in all of our travels around the world and that is no joke. We were so grateful for this top notch service!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, staff, and experience”
Reviews.Author: katisso
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Istanbul, and the Empire Palace was the perfect base of operations for exploring the area. It is within easy walking distance of a wide variety of attractions and just moments from a tram stop and the water. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was incredible and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to answer any questions we had. Berrin went above and beyond the call to make sure we got to where we wanted to go, and Mostafa, Golscha, and the rest of the staff made our entire stay more like a visit home with friends than a week living out of a suitcase in a strange city.

Reviews.Title: “you better stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: onyongLosAngeles_Ca
Reviews.Content: i stayed here from 4/22-4/29, 2009 with my friend norman and two of his relatives. we had two single bed rooms. location wise, it is the best. you are near the tram stop and it is only a few short stops south of the topkapi palace, hagia sophia, blue mosque and the underground cisterns. south of the hotel, you can pretty much walk or have a short ride again to the hamdi restaurant, to the train station to watch the whirling dervish or go over to galata tower and dolmahbace palace. room is nice just as in the picture. service from the hotel receptionists like ergin alcar, yavuz and ozma were sweet!!! they speak english. thank God. they were very helpful, accomodating, ready and willing to show us what we need, need to know and need to learn. kudos to them. overall, it was a very wonderful exciting different journey i've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ista
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about this hotel is its location for it is near the tram stop and is within walking distance to most of Sultanhamet's sights. The staff was very cordial and helpful, specially Ergin Alcar and Yavuz, as well as the female front desk personnel (whose name escapes me right now). They were as hospitable as they can be. Like most European hotels the rooms were small but meticulously clean. Overall we had a very comfortable stay. The only down side of this hotel is its breakfast buffet which could use a little working on. They had the same stuff in all our six nights. The scrambled eggs and sausage always came late and the raw fruits were not the best-looking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic location and room... Ergin and Mustafa Made it feel like home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: dcmason
Reviews.Content: I generaly wouldn't go for a Best Western in the US... however, this one is a jewel! Beautiful hotel, very classy, great location and best of all, the staff went out of their way to make sure the stay was comfortable and the visit to Istanbul was as rich as possible. The gentleman at the front desk, Ergin Akar, was professional, welcoming and full of fantastic recommendations on not only hotel services, but how to navigate the city / country. Big thanks!!! Our bartender and "hooka teacher", Mustafa Can, was equally amazing... and handsome too! :-) He always had night caps and great stories ready as we ended our sightseeing days. How wonderful to fly 6k miles and find a new friend! Overall travelers, this hotel is a great value and a pleasure to call a home away from home...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent staff, standart rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aspire73
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel. The hotel is located in one of the prime areas of Istanbul. Close to tourist atractions as well as shopping destinations. The staff is very helpful and I saw some familiar faces as this was my second stay. The rooms are standart sized, clean and cozy. As I stayed at Easter weekend, I had to pay a bigger bill compared to last time. I would like to acknowledge a particular person at the front desk. Her name is Berrin. She is very hepful and understanding. I got an early check in and late check out as she helped me big time. If you are looking for a cozy, friendly place and you are not looking for luxury this is your place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location. Sara Perth Western Australia”
Reviews.Author: Louise19641109
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey and we found the Empire Palace a fantastic place to stay. The location was very central to all the cultural sites we were interested in so we were able to walk. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was lovely and the whole staff were especially kind to our child. We would stay again if we went back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this overpriced hotel...ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lubba7
Reviews.Content: Hi all. I am a reasonable person when it comes to hotels- i want a clean decent sized room, no mistakes with the booking and helpful staff. If you are the same then DO NOT try this hotel. On the night we got there they mistakingly gave us a twin room, they were not even apologetic nor did they offer us any form of compensation. The hotel staff suggested we push the beds together- the cheek. The did it for us but it was awful as i kept falling down the middle. The room itself was very noisy as the tram went right by the hotel and was very close to this room. My huband cheekily asked for a free meal in the hotel- which they gave...more fool us. It was disgusting food, and as we had heard the microwave going in the kitchen, we knew how they had cooked the food. If we had paid, it would have costed 30 euros a head! We did have to pay for our drinks, and 2 cokes was the equivalent of Â£5! We were very disappointed. The next day we were given a superior double room- nothing superior about this tiny room with too much furtniture crammed in- not worth the money at all, even if we did get a deal through expedia. The staff were not helpful with anything generally and tried to extort us for money every chance we got. The second day we had a turkish bath at the hotel, which was surprisingly good, but very expensive for what it was. My husband and i decided to have another Turkish bath (a salt scrub to be exact) the night before we left, but for me this was a disaster. A different woman did it and it was awful. The salt was burning my skin, the room itself was freezing, the woman couldn't speak a word of english or french, and she didn't know how to give a massage so it was just painful as i lay there in my bikini. Then the ditsy woman put the glass salt pot right near my elbow, it inevitably smashed and so she just rubbed me down with soapy water instead and tried to charge me for it. It was horrible!!! it really did ruin the whole experience and i would never stay in this supposed 4* hotel. To be honest I have stayed in hostels nicer than this place. The ONLY upside to this hotel would be the location, as it is in walking distance to the main sites- the blue mosque, hagia sophia etc. I did read the reviews on this site before i left, but i have the feeling the staff members may have made a few things up about the hotel on here so be weary. Erjan was NOT helpful at all, all the staff were USELESS, none of them seemed to care about the guests and it was just on the whole very disappointing. We need to get rid of foreign hotels ripping off tourists and taking advantage, so please stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hanife22
Reviews.Content: We have recently come back from our first trip to Turkey. We had a magical time in Istanbul and stayed in a hotel that was pefect in location and close to such historical places as the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel we stayed in was absolutely brilliant. The rooms were a good size, clean, as was the bathroom. One of the things that made our holiday memorable and wonderful was the service we received in the hotel. This was second to none and the friendly faces every day was very welcoming, in particular a member of staff called Beste. She was always able to help us out or arrange excursions for us. She was always helpful and kind and was an asset to the hotel. She could not do enough to help us. We found Beste to be very knowledgeable about the city and had a very approchable and friendly demeanour and was always ready with a smile. If we return to Istanbul again, as I am sure we will, we will definitely be staying at the Best Western Empire Palace again. Not only because of the wonderful hotel and team, but also because of Beste. Thanks again to the team at the BW Empire Palace for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul, a city with people worth more than can be captured”
Reviews.Author: Rossouw
Reviews.Content: Jan 2009 we travelled to Finland, St Petersburg, Stockholm and Istanbul, where we found a little tucked away gem!!! We were so fortunate to stay with people who cared, not only because they are in the tourist industry but because they really care about people! Thanks Ercan for making us feel welcome not only in the Empire Palace, but also in Istanbul. The friendly, efficient way in which you helped plan our days made it an experience we will never forget. Your suggestions for our short stay ensured we saw and experienced the best of Istanbul. We are telling people about your stunning country and its friendly people and we can assure you the group that you represent will definitely be on our must stay list for all future trips! We loved Istanbul! Palaces, museums, belly dancers to name just a few, fill everybodys photo albums, but the caring fills more than what a photo album can take. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christhawkins
Reviews.Content: This was the first time i have been in Istanbul. There were geat staff that i have met , service , restaurant and breakfast was perfect. The hotel has great location. You can reach many historical places , the hotel on the train way . In my opinion , the hotel gives you many advantages , according to this advantages you can choose this hotel. In a restaurant , the girl whose name is Berrin, she was very helpful , successful and friendly. If i want to go to istanbul again , i would prefer this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The Empire Palace is great!”
Reviews.Author: NathanielNutmeg
Reviews.Content: Great room, great position, very clean and obviously well run, staff courteous, friendly and very helpful. We fell on our feet here. Would recommend highly.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Empire Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Hudavendigar Cad. No:17 / 19 | Hocapasa Mah. - Sirkeci/Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
